page.title: 05COMMUNITY SUPPORT
page.content: Without the village hall, community activies within the village would be severely curtailed if not well nigh impossible. The remoteness of the village would become far more evident and the community would naturally look outside the village to fill the social gap. After twenty-five years of weathering the hall roof is beginning to leak badly. Again, with help from the County Council, the villagers have raised the Â£4200 needed for repairs in a remarkably short time. Money is being collected through raffles, coffee evenings, sponsored events and donations. Even the schoolchildren have helped by giving a concert.
